title: Applying Self-Regulated Learning Strategies to Enhance Retention and Effectiveness in MOOC Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: For students and job seekers with intermediate expertise in social fields, aiming to improve MOOC (Massive Open Online Course) completion rates and effectiveness by strengthening self-directed learning competencies in simulation/VR environments.

learning_goals: Learners can improve MOOC completion rates by over 30% by utilizing self-regulated learning strategies (metacognition, time management, environmental structuring).
Learners can resolve over 50% of difficulties encountered during the learning process through enhanced recognition of task value and self-efficacy.
Learners can practice analyzing real-world social issues and implementing solution strategies at least three times using VR-based simulations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
